member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.render
member.summary: Immediately forces the calendar to render and/or readjusts its size. This method is useful in the scenario where a tab setup might hide/show a calendar. Call this method whenever the tabs are shown. Notice that this example calls render whenever any tab is shown, not just the tab that the calendar is within. This is okay, because FullCalendar is smart enough to only render calendars that are visible to the user.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.destroy
member.summary: Restores the element to the state before FullCalendar was initialized. Removes elements, events handlers, and internal data.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.getView
member.summary: This is useful if you want to get information about the calendarâ€™s title or start/end dates.
member.returns: Returns the View Object for the current view.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.changeView(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString)
member.summary: Immediately switches to a different view.
member.param: viewName must be a string value containing one of the Available Views.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.changeView(SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews)
member.summary: Immediately switches to a different view.
member.param: viewName must be a string value containing one of the Available Views.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.prev
member.summary: Moves the calendar one step back (either by a month, week, or day). If the calendar is in month view, will move the calendar back one month. If the calendar is in basicWeek or agendaWeek, will move the calendar back one week. If the calendar is in basicDay or agendaDay, will move the calendar back one day.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.next
member.summary: Moves the calendar one step forward (either by a month, week, or day). If the calendar is in month view, will move the calendar forward one month. If the calendar is in basicWeek or agendaWeek, will move the calendar forward one week. If the calendar is in basicDay or agendaDay, will move the calendar forward one day. Example using next with an external button:

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.prevYear
member.summary: Moves the calendar back one year. Version 1.3.x did not include this method, but you can use .fullCalendar('incrementDate', -1) instead.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.nextYear
member.summary: Moves the calendar forward one year. Version 1.3.x did not include this method, but you can use .fullCalendar('incrementDate', 1) instead.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.today
member.summary: Moves the calendar to the current date.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.gotoDate(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate)
member.summary: Moves the calendar to an arbitrary year/month/date. IMPORTANT: month is 0-based, meaning January=0, February=1, etc. This method can also be called with a single argument, a Date object (only works in versions >= 1.3.2).
member.param: IMPORTANT: month is 0-based, meaning January=0, February=1, etc.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.gotoDate(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate)
member.summary: Moves the calendar to an arbitrary year/month/date. IMPORTANT: month is 0-based, meaning January=0, February=1, etc. This method can also be called with a single argument, a Date object (only works in versions >= 1.3.2).

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.incrementDate(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber)
member.summary: Moves the calendar forward/backward an arbitrary amount of time.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.incrementDate(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber)
member.summary: Moves the calendar forward/backward an arbitrary amount of time.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.getDate
member.summary: For month view, it will always be sometime between the first and last day of the month. For week views, it will always be sometime between the first and last day of the week.
member.returns: Returns a Date object for the current date of the calendar.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.updateEvent(SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event)
member.summary: Reports changes to an event and renders them on the calendar.
member.param: event must be the original Event Object for an event, not merely a reconstructed object. The original Event Object can obtained by callbacks such as eventClick, or by the clientEvents method.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.clientEvents(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString)
member.summary: Retrieves events that FullCalendar has in memory. This method will return an array of Event Objects that FullCalendar has stored in client-side memory. If idOrFilter is omitted, all events will be returned. If idOrFilter is an ID, all events with the same ID will be returned. idOrFilter may also be a filter function that accepts one Event Object argument and returns true if it should be included in the result set. In versions 1.2 and 1.2.1, this option was known as getEventsByID

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.clientEvents(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsFunc{SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retrieves events that FullCalendar has in memory. This method will return an array of Event Objects that FullCalendar has stored in client-side memory. If idOrFilter is omitted, all events will be returned. If idOrFilter is an ID, all events with the same ID will be returned. idOrFilter may also be a filter function that accepts one Event Object argument and returns true if it should be included in the result set. In versions 1.2 and 1.2.1, this option was known as getEventsByID

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.clientEvents
member.summary: Retrieves events that FullCalendar has in memory. This method will return an array of Event Objects that FullCalendar has stored in client-side memory. If idOrFilter is omitted, all events will be returned. If idOrFilter is an ID, all events with the same ID will be returned. idOrFilter may also be a filter function that accepts one Event Object argument and returns true if it should be included in the result set. In versions 1.2 and 1.2.1, this option was known as getEventsByID

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.removeEvents(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes events from the calendar. .fullCalendar( 'removeEvents' [, idOrFilter ] ) If idOrFilter is omitted, all events are removed. If idOrFilter is an ID, all events with the same ID will be removed. idOrFilter may also be a filter function that accepts one Event Object argument and returns true if it should be removed.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.refetchEvents
member.summary: Refetches events from all sources and rerenders them on the screen. Prior to version 1.3, the same effect was achieved by the refresh method.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.addEventSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Dynamically adds an event source.
member.param: Source may be an Array/URL/Function just as in the events option. Events will be immediately fetched from this source and placed on the calendar.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.removeEventSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Dynamically removes an event source. Events from the source will immediately be removed from the calendar. Prior to version 1.5, things were more strict. You must specify a reference to the original Array/URL/Function.
member.param: Since version 1.5, the source parameter has become rather relaxed. You can provide an event source's Array/URL/Function or you can specify the full Event Source Object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.renderEvent(SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders a new event on the calendar.
member.param: event must be an Event Object with a title and start at the very least.

Normally, the event will disappear once the calendar refetches its event sources (example: when prev/next is clicked). However, specifying stick as true will cause the event to be permanently fixed to the calendar.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.renderEvent(SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event)
member.summary: Renders a new event on the calendar.
member.param: event must be an Event Object with a title and start at the very least.

Normally, the event will disappear once the calendar refetches its event sources (example: when prev/next is clicked). However, specifying stick as true will cause the event to be permanently fixed to the calendar.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.rerenderEvents
member.summary: Rerenders all events on the calendar. Prior to version 1.3, the same effect could be achieved by the refresh method.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.defaultViewString
member.summary: The initial view when the calendar loads. default: 'month'

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.defaultView
member.summary: The initial view when the calendar loads. default: 'month'

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.year
member.summary: The initial year when the calendar loads. Must be a 4-digit year like 2009. If year is unspecified, the calendar will begin at the current year.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.month
member.summary: The initial month when the calendar loads. IMPORTANT: The value is 0-based, meaning January=0, February=1, etc. If month is unspecified and year is set to the current year, the calendar will start on the current month. If month is unspecified and year is not set to the current year, the calendar will start on January.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.timeFormat
P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.columnFormat
member.summary: Determines the text that will be displayed on the calendar's column headings. can also be a View Option Hash type default: { month: 'ddd', // Mon week: 'ddd M/d', // Mon 9/7 day: 'dddd M/d' // Monday 9/7 } A single string will set the title format for all views. A View Option Hash may be provided to target specific views (this is what the default does). Uses formatDate/formatDates formatting rules. (The formatting rules were much different in versions before 1.3. See here)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.titleFormat
member.summary: Determines the text that will be displayed in the header's title. can also be a View Option Hash type default: { month: 'MMMM yyyy', // September 2009 week: "MMM d[ yyyy]{ '—'[ MMM] d yyyy}", // Sep 7 - 13 2009 day: 'dddd, MMM d, yyyy' // Tuesday, Sep 8, 2009 } A single string will set the title format for all views. A View Option Hash may be provided to target specific views (this is what the default does). Uses formatDate/formatDates formatting rules. (The formatting rules were much different in versions before 1.3. See here)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.monthNames
member.summary: Full names of months. default: ['January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June', 'July', 'August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December'] (Prior to version 1.3, this was possible by setting $.fullCalendar.monthNames)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.monthNamesShort
member.summary: Abbreviated names of months. default: ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun' 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'] (Prior to version 1.3, this was possible by setting $.fullCalendar.monthAbbrevs)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dayNames
member.summary: Full names of days-of-week. default: ['Sunday', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday'] (Prior to version 1.3, this was possible by setting $.fullCalendar.dayNames)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dayNamesShort
member.summary: Abbreviated names of days-of-week. default: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'] (Prior to version 1.3, this was possible by setting $.fullCalendar.dayAbbrevs)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dayClick
member.summary: Triggered when the user clicks on a day. function( date, allDay, jsEvent, view ) { } date holds a Date object for the current day. If user has clicked on a slot in the agendaWeek or agendaDay views, date will also have its time set. allDay will be set to true false if the user has clicked on a slot in the agendaWeek or agendaDay views. Otherwise, it will be true. jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as click coordinates. view is set to the current View Object. Within the callback function, this is set to the <td> of the clicked day.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventClick
member.summary: Triggered when the user clicks an event. function( event, jsEvent, view ) { } event is an Event Object that holds the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as click coordinates. view holds the current View Object. Within the callback function, this is set to the event's <div> element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventMouseover
member.summary: Triggered when the user mouses over an event. function( event, jsEvent, view ) { } event is an Event Object that holds the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates. view holds the current View Object. Within the callback function, this is set to the event's <div> element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventMouseout
member.summary: Triggered when the user mouses out of an event. function( event, jsEvent, view ) { } event is an Event Object that holds the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates. view holds the current View Object. Within the callback function, this is set to the event's <div> element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.selectableBoolean
member.summary: Allows a user to highlight multiple days or timeslots by clicking and dragging. To let the user make selections by clicking and dragging, this option must be set to true. The select and unselect callbacks will be useful for monitoring when selections are made and cleared. To learn the ways in which selections can be cleared, read the docs for the unselect callback. To view an example of how to create a new event based on a user's selection see "demos/selectable.html" in the download, or visit this page.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.selectable
member.summary: Allows a user to highlight multiple days or timeslots by clicking and dragging. To let the user make selections by clicking and dragging, this option must be set to true. The select and unselect callbacks will be useful for monitoring when selections are made and cleared. To learn the ways in which selections can be cleared, read the docs for the unselect callback. To view an example of how to create a new event based on a user's selection see "demos/selectable.html" in the download, or visit this page.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.selectHelper
member.summary: Whether to draw a "placeholder" event while the user is dragging. This option only applies to the agenda views. A value of true will draw a "placeholder" event while the user is dragging (similar to what Google Calendar does for its week and day views). A value of false (the default) will draw the standard highlighting over each cell. A function can also be specified for drawing custom elements. It will be given 2 arguments: the selection's start date and end date (Date objects). It must return a DOM element that will be used.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.selectHelperFunction
member.summary: Whether to draw a "placeholder" event while the user is dragging. This option only applies to the agenda views. A value of true will draw a "placeholder" event while the user is dragging (similar to what Google Calendar does for its week and day views). A value of false (the default) will draw the standard highlighting over each cell. A function can also be specified for drawing custom elements. It will be given 2 arguments: the selection's start date and end date (Date objects). It must return a DOM element that will be used.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.unselectAuto
member.summary: Whether clicking elsewhere on the page will cause the current selection to be cleared. This option can only take effect when selectable is set to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.unselectCancel
member.summary: A way to specify elements that will ignore the unselectAuto option. Clicking on elements that match this jQuery selector will prevent the current selection from being cleared (due to the unselectAuto option). This option is useful if you have a "Create an event" form that shows up in response to the user making a selection. When the user clicks on this form, you probably don't want to the current selection to go away. Thus, you should add a class to your form such as "my-form", and set the unselectCancel option to ".my-form".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.select
member.summary: A callback that will fire after a selection is made. function( startDate, endDate, allDay, jsEvent, view ) startDate is a Date object indicating the beginning of the selection. endDate is a Date object indicating the end of the selection. It follows the same rules as the Event Object for inclusivity/exclusivity: when allDay is true, endDate includes the last day. allDay is a boolean indicating if entire days were selected (days in month view or the "all-day" slot in the agenda view) or time slots were selected. jsEvent holds the primitive JavaScript event with information such as mouse coordinates. If select has been triggered via the select method, jsEvent will be undefined. (added in version 1.4.7)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.unselect
member.summary: A callback that will fire when the current selection is cleared. function( view, jsEvent ) A selection might be cleared for a number of reasons: 1. The user clicks away from the current selection (doesn't happen when unselectAuto is false). 2. The user makes a new selection. The unselect callback will be fired before the new selection occurs. 3. The user moves forward or backward in the current view, or switches to a new view. 4. The unselect method is called through the API. jsEvent holds the primitive JavaScript event with information such as mouse coordinates. If unselect has been triggered via the unselect method, jsEvent will be undefined. (added in version 1.4.7)

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.events
member.summary: An array of Event Objects that will be displayed on the calendar. Make sure you do not have a comma after the last event in your array! It will make Internet Explorer choke.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventSources
member.summary: A way to specify multiple event sources. This option is used instead of the events option. You can put any number of event arrays, functions, JSON feed URLs, or full-out Event Source Objects into the eventSources array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.allDayDefault
member.summary: Determines the default value for each Event Object's allDay property, when it is unspecified. default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.ignoreTimezone
member.summary: When parsing ISO8601 dates, whether UTC offsets should be ignored while processing event source data. default: true The default is true, which means the UTC offset for all ISO8601 dates will be ignored. For example, the date "2008-11-05T08:15:30-05:00" will be processed as November 5th, 2008 at 8:15am in the local offset of the browser. If you are using ISO8601 dates with UTC offsets, chances are you want them processed. You must set this option to false. In the future, the default for this option will probably be changed to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.startParam
member.summary: A GET parameter of this name will be inserted into each JSON feed's URL. default: 'start' The value of this GET parameter will be a UNIX timestamp denoting the start of the first visible day (inclusive).

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.endParam
member.summary: A GET parameter of this name will be inserted into each JSON feed's URL. default: 'end' The value of this GET parameter will be a UNIX timestamp denoting the end of the last visible day (exclusive).

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.lazyFetching
member.summary: Determines when event fetching should occur. default: true When set to true (the default), the calendar will only fetch events when it absolutely needs to, minimizing AJAX calls. For example, say your calendar starts out in month view, in February. FullCalendar will fetch events for the entire month of February and store them in its internal cache. Then, say the user switches to week view and begins browsing the weeks in February. The calendar will avoid fetching events because it already has this information stored. When set to false, the calendar will fetch events any time the view is switched, or any time the current date changes (for example, as a result of the user clicking prev/next).

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.loading
member.summary: Triggered when event fetching starts/stops. Triggered with a true argument when the calendar begins fetching events via AJAX. Triggered with false when done. view is the current View Object. This function is often used to show/hide a loading indicator.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventColor
member.summary: Sets the background and border colors for all events on the calendar. You can use any of the CSS color formats such #f00, #ff0000, rgb(255,0,0), or red. This option can be overridden on a per-source basis with the color Event Source Object option or on a per-event basis with the color Event Object option.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventBackgroundColor
member.summary: Sets the background color for all events on the calendar. You can use any of the CSS color formats such #f00, #ff0000, rgb(255,0,0), or red. This option can be overridden on a per-source basis with the color Event Source Object option or on a per-event basis with the color Event Object option.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventBorderColor
member.summary: Sets the border color for all events on the calendar. You can use any of the CSS color formats such #f00, #ff0000, rgb(255,0,0), or red. This option can be overridden on a per-source basis with the color Event Source Object option or on a per-event basis with the color Event Object option.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventTextColor
member.summary: Sets the text color for all events on the calendar. You can use any of the CSS color formats such #f00, #ff0000, rgb(255,0,0), or red. This option can be overridden on a per-source basis with the color Event Source Object option or on a per-event basis with the color Event Object option.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventAfterRender
member.summary: Triggered after an event has been placed on the calendar in its final position.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventDragStart
member.summary: Triggered when event dragging begins. function( event, jsEvent, ui, view ) { } event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native javascript event with low-level information such as click coordinates. ui holds the jQuery UI object. view holds the current View Object.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventDragStop
member.summary: Triggered when event dragging stops. function( event, jsEvent, ui, view ) { } This callback is guaranteed to be triggered after the user drags an event, even if the event doesn't change date/time. It is triggered before the event's information has been modified (if moved to a new date/time) and before the eventDrop callback is triggered. event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates. ui holds the jQuery UI object. view holds the current View Object.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventDrop
member.summary: Triggered when dragging stops and the event has moved to a different day/time.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventResizeStart
member.summary: Triggered when event resizing begins. function( event, jsEvent, ui, view ) { } event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates. ui holds the jQuery UI object. view holds the current View Object.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventResizeStop
member.summary: Triggered when event resizing stops. function( event, jsEvent, ui, view ) { } This callback is guaranteed to be triggered after the user resizes an event, even if the event doesn't change in duration. It is triggered before the event's information has been modified (if changed in duration) and before the eventResize callback is triggered. event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc). jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates. ui holds the jQuery UI object. view holds the current View Object.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.eventResize
member.summary: Triggered when resizing stops and the event has changed in duration.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.editable
member.summary: Determines whether the events on the calendar can be modified. default: false This determines if the events can be dragged and resized. Enables/disables both at the same time. If you don't want both, use editable in conjunction with disableDragging and disableResizing. This option can be overridden on a per-event basis with the Event Object editable property. Prior to version 1.3, the draggable option was used instead.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.disableDragging
member.summary: Disables all event dragging, even when events are editable. default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.disableResizing
member.summary: Disables all event resizing, even when events are editable. default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dragRevertDuration
member.summary: Time it takes for an event to revert to its original position after an unsuccessful drag. default: 500 Time is in milliseconds (1 second = 1000 milliseconds). Prior to version 1.3, this option was known as eventRevertDuration

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dragOpacity
P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.droppable
member.summary: Determines if jQuery UI draggables can be dropped onto the calendar. This option operates with jQuery UI draggables. You must download the appropriate jQuery UI files and initialize a draggable element. Additionally, you must set the calendar's droppable option to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dropAccept
member.summary: Provides a way to filter which elements can be dropped onto the calendar. By default, after setting a calendar' droppable option to true, the calendar will accept any draggables that are dropped onto the calendar. The dropAccept option allows the calendar be more selective about which elements can/can't be dropped. The value of dropAccept can be a string jQuery selector. It can also be a function that accepts the draggable item as a single argument, and returns true if the element can be dropped onto the calendar.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.dropAcceptFunction
member.summary: Provides a way to filter which elements can be dropped onto the calendar. By default, after setting a calendar' droppable option to true, the calendar will accept any draggables that are dropped onto the calendar. The dropAccept option allows the calendar be more selective about which elements can/can't be dropped. The value of dropAccept can be a string jQuery selector. It can also be a function that accepts the draggable item as a single argument, and returns true if the element can be dropped onto the calendar.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendar.drop
member.summary: Called when a valid jQuery UI draggable has been dropped onto the calendar. function( date, allDay, jsEvent, ui ) { } date holds the JavaScript Date object of where the draggable was dropped. allDay holds a boolean of whether the draggable was dropped on an all-day cell (like in month view) or in a slot with a specific time (like in agenda view). jsEvent holds the primitive JavaScript event, with information like mouse coordinates. ui holds the jQuery UI information. this holds the DOM element that has been dropped. To see this callback function in action, view the droppable article or look at this example.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarHeader
member.summary: Defines the buttons and title at the top of the calendar. Setting the header options to false will display no header. An object can be supplied with properties left, center, and right. These properties contain strings with comma/space separated values. Values separated by a comma will be displayed adjacently. Values separated by a space will be displayed with a small gap in between. Strings can contain any of the following values:

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.header
member.summary: Defines the buttons and title at the top of the calendar.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.buttonIcons
member.summary:
Determines which theme icons appear on the header buttons. This option only applies to calendars that have jQuery UI theming enabled with the theme option.
A hash must be supplied that maps button names (from the header) to icon strings. The icon strings determine the CSS class that will be used on the button. For example, the string 'circle-triangle-w' will result in the class 'ui-icon-triangle-w'.
If a button does not have an entry, it falls back to using buttonText.
If you are using a jQuery UI theme and would prefer not to display any icons and would rather use buttonText instead, you can set the buttonIcons option to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.firstDay
member.summary: The day that each week begins. default: 0 (Sunday) The value must be a number that represents the day of the week. Sunday=0, Monday=1, Tuesday=2, etc. This option is useful for UK users who need the week to start on Monday (1).

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.isRTL
member.summary: Displays the calendar in right-to-left mode. default: false This option is useful for right-to-left languages such as Arabic and Hebrew.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.weekends
member.summary: Whether to include Saturday/Sunday columns in any of the calendar views. default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.weekModeString
member.summary: Determines the number of weeks displayed in a month view. Also determines each week's height. default: 'fixed' Available options: 'fixed' The calendar will always be 6 weeks tall. The height will always be the same, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio. 'liquid' The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. The height of the weeks will stretch to fill the available height, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio. 'variable' The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. Each week will have the same constant height, meaning the calendarâ€™s height will change month-to-month.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.weekMode
member.summary: Determines the number of weeks displayed in a month view. Also determines each week's height. default: 'fixed' Available options: 'fixed' The calendar will always be 6 weeks tall. The height will always be the same, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio. 'liquid' The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. The height of the weeks will stretch to fill the available height, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio. 'variable' The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. Each week will have the same constant height, meaning the calendarâ€™s height will change month-to-month.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.height
member.summary: Will make the entire calendar (including header) a pixel height. By default, this option is unset and the calendar's height is calculated by aspectRatio.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.contentHeight
member.summary: Will make the calendar's content area a pixel height. By default, this option is unset and the calendar's height is calculated by aspectRatio.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.aspectRatio
member.summary: Determines the width-to-height aspect ratio of the calendar. A calendar is a block-level element that fills its entire avaiable width. The calendarâ€™s height, however, is determined by this ratio of width-to-height. (Hint: larger numbers make smaller heights).

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.viewDisplay
member.summary: Triggered when the calendar loads and every time a different date-range is displayed. function( view ) { } The calendar's date-range changes whenever the user switches to a new view (for example, if they switch from "month" to "agendaWeek") or when they click the prev/next buttons. view is the current View Object. Within the callback function, this will be set to the calendar's main element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.FullCalendarOptions.windowResize
member.summary: Triggered after the calendar's dimensions have been changed due to the browser window being resized. function( view ) { } The calendar has automatically adapted to the new size when windowResize is triggered. view is the current View Object. Within the callback function, this will be set to the calendar's main element.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.EventDrop
member.summary: Triggered when dragging stops and the event has moved to a different day/time.
member.param: event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc).
dayDelta holds the number of days the event was moved forward (a positive number) or backwards (a negative number).
minuteDelta holds the number of minutes the event was moved forward (a positive number) or backwards (a negative number). Only useful for the agenda views. In other views, 0 is passed in.

allDay is true if the event has been dropped on a day in month view, or the "all-day" slot in the agenda views. It will be false if dropped on a slot in the agenda views (meaning it has been assigned a time).
revertFunc is a function that, if called, reverts the event's start/end date to the values before the drag. This is useful if an ajax call should fail.
jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates.
ui holds the jQuery UI object.
view holds the current View Object.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.EventResize
member.summary: Triggered when resizing stops and the event has changed in duration.
member.param: event is an Event Object that hold the event's information (date, title, etc).
dayDelta holds the number of days the event was moved forward (a positive number) or backwards (a negative number).
minuteDelta holds the number of minutes the event was moved forward (a positive number) or backwards (a negative number). Only useful for the agenda views. In other views, 0 is passed in.
revertFunc is a function that, if called, reverts the event's start/end date to the values before the drag. This is useful if an ajax call should fail.
jsEvent holds the native JavaScript event with low-level information such as mouse coordinates.
ui holds the jQuery UI object.
view holds the current View Object.

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.weekModeType.fixed
member.summary: The calendar will always be 6 weeks tall. The height will always be the same, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio.

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.weekModeType.liquid
member.summary: The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. The height of the weeks will stretch to fill the available height, as determined by height, contentHeight, or aspectRatio.

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.weekModeType.variable
member.summary: The calendar will have either 4, 5, or 6 weeks, depending on the month. Each week will have the same constant height, meaning the calendarâ€™s height will change month-to-month.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews
member.summary: FullCalendar has a number of different "views", or ways of displaying days and events. The following 5 views are all built in to FullCalendar: You can define header buttons to allow the user to switch between them. You can set the initial view of the calendar with the defaultView option.

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews.basicWeek
member.summary: (available since version 1.3)

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews.basicDay
member.summary: (available since version 1.3)

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews.agendaWeek
member.summary: (available since version 1.4)

member.name: F:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AvailableViews.agendaDay
member.summary: (available since version 1.4)

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View
member.summary: An object that is passed to every callback, containing info about the current view.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.name
member.summary: Name of one of the Available Views

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.title
member.summary: Title text that is displayed at the top of the header (such as "September 2009" or "Sep 7 - 13 2009").

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.start
member.summary: A Date object of the first day of the month/week. If in day-view, the date of the single day.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.end
member.summary: A Date object of the day after the last day of the month/week. If in day-view, the Date after the single day. Because this is an exclusive value, if the calendar has a month-view on October 2009, end will be November 1st.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.visStart
member.summary: A Date object of the first visible day of the view. In month-view, this value is often before the 1st day of the month, because most months do not begin on a Monday. In week and day views, this value will always be the same as start.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.View.visEnd
member.summary: A Date object of the day after the last visible day (because it is exclusive like end).

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.ViewOptionHash
member.summary: the class is empty

member.name: T:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions
member.summary: The following options only apply to the agendaWeek and agendaDay views:

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.allDaySlot
member.summary: Determines if the "all-day" slot is displayed at the top of the calendar. default: true When hidden with false, all-day events will not be displayed in agenda views.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.allDayText
member.summary: The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar. default: 'all-day'

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.axisFormat
member.summary: Determines the time-text that will be displayed on the vertical axis of the agenda views. default: 'h(:mm)tt' The value is a format-string that will be processed by formatDate. The default value will produce times that look like "5pm" and "5:30pm".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.slotMinutes
member.summary: The frequency for displaying time slots, in minutes. default: 30 The default will make a slot every half hour.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.defaultEventMinutes
member.summary: Determines the length (in minutes) an event appears to be when it has an unspecified end date. default: 120 By default, if an Event Object as no end, it will appear to be 2 hours. This option only affects events that appear in the agenda slots, meaning they have allDay set to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.firstHour
member.summary: Determines the first hour that will be visible in the scroll pane. default: 6 Values must be from 0-23, where 0=midnight, 1=1am, etc. The user will be able to scroll upwards to see events before this time. If you want to prevent users from doing this, use the minTime option instead.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.minTime
member.summary: Determines the first hour/time that will be displayed, even when the scrollbars have been scrolled all the way up. default: 0 This can be a number like 5 (which means 5am), a string like '5:30' (which means 5:30am) or a string like '5:30am'.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.minTimeString
member.summary: Determines the first hour/time that will be displayed, even when the scrollbars have been scrolled all the way up. default: 0 This can be a number like 5 (which means 5am), a string like '5:30' (which means 5:30am) or a string like '5:30am'.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.maxTime
member.summary: Determines the last hour/time (exclusively) that will be displayed, even when the scrollbars have been scrolled all the way down. default: 24 This can be a number like 22 (which means 10pm), a string like '22:30' (which means 10:30pm) or a string like '10:30pm'.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.AgendaOptions.maxTimeString
member.summary: Determines the last hour/time (exclusively) that will be displayed, even when the scrollbars have been scrolled all the way down. default: 24 This can be a number like 22 (which means 10pm), a string like '22:30' (which means 10:30pm) or a string like '10:30pm'.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.idString
member.summary: Optional Uniquely identifies the given event. Different instances of repeating events should all have the same id.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.id
member.summary: Optional Uniquely identifies the given event. Different instances of repeating events should all have the same id.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.title
member.summary: Required. The text on an event's element

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.allDay
member.summary: Optional. Whether an event occurs at a specific time-of-day. This property affects whether an event's time is shown. Also, in the agenda views, determines if it is displayed in the "all-day" section. Don't include quotes around your true/false. This value is not a string! When specifying Event Objects for events or eventSources, omitting this property will make it inherit from allDayDefault, which is normally true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.start
member.summary: Required. The date/time an event begins. When specifying Event Objects for events or eventSources, you may specify a string in IETF format (ex: "Wed, 18 Oct 2009 13:00:00 EST"), a string in ISO8601 format (ex: "2009-11-05T13:15:30Z") or a UNIX timestamp.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.end
member.summary: Date. Optional. The date/time an event ends. As with start, you may specify it in IETF, ISO8601, or UNIX timestamp format. If an event is all-day... the end date is inclusive. This means an event with start Nov 10 and end Nov 12 will span 3 days on the calendar. If an event is NOT all-day... the end date is exclusive. This is only a gotcha when your end has time 00:00. It means your event ends on midnight, and it will not span through the next day.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.url
member.summary: Optional. A URL that will be visited when this event is clicked by the user. For more information on controlling this behavior, see the eventClick callback.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.className
member.summary: Optional. A CSS class (or array of classes) that will be attached to this event's element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.classNameArray
member.summary: Optional. A CSS class (or array of classes) that will be attached to this event's element.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.editable
member.summary: Optional. Overrides the master editable option for this single event.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Arshaw.FullCalendar.Event.source
member.summary: Automatically populated. A reference to the event source that this event came from
